string-array.name: internals_content
string-array.item: Linux kernel
Bionic libc
Dalvik VM

string-array.name: starting_content
string-array.item: Android SDK: \nhttp://developer.android.com/sdk/
Eclipse: \nhttp://www.eclipse.org/downloads/
Eclipse ADT plugin: \nhttp://developer.android.com/sdk/eclipse-adt.html \n(not available in the Eclipse Marketplace)

string-array.name: debug_content
string-array.item: Debugging in Eclipse (breakpoints, watches, etc.)
ADB (Android Debug Bridge): Linux shell, log viewer, upload/download files from device
DDMS (Dalvik Debug Monitor Server): Screenshots, thread dumps, heap dumps
Traceview: Profiling
Hierarchy viewer: Inspect your UI

string-array.name: debug_log_content
string-array.item: System logger: android.util.Log
adb logcat (view logs from connected system)
aLogcat (view logs on device)
Log levels: \nVerbose, Debug, Info, Warn, Error, WTF

string-array.name: dalvik_content
string-array.item: Android\'s virtual machine optimized for mobile devices
Each app gets its own VM
Register-based, executes Dalvik bytecode from Dalvik executables
JIT compiler generates native code at runtime

string-array.name: dalvik_java_content
string-array.item: Android SDK can translate Java bytecode to Dalvik bytecode
Apache Harmony provides implementations of most of the Java class library
Prefer C or C++? Dalvik can call native code via JNI.
Android 2.3 (Gingerbread) expands native support significantly

string-array.name: api_content
string-array.item: Basic: Views, preferences, database, private storage, media playback, access to system databases, ability to talk to other apps / services
Device capabilities (most require permissions): Network access, location (network and/or GPS), camera, audio capture
Low-level: 3D graphics (OpenGL ES), audio (OpenSL ES)

string-array.name: parts_other_content
string-array.item: Homescreen widgets
Background services
Broadcast receivers
Dialogs

string-array.name: apps_content
string-array.item: Live wallpapers
Launchers
On-screen keyboards

string-array.name: lifecycle_content
string-array.item: When the user presses the \"Home\" button, the task is pushed to the background
Background tasks are freed by the system when memory is low
You get a chance to save your state: Override onSaveInstanceState
Activity onCreate gets passed a Bundle: If it\'s not null, then use it to restore your state

string-array.name: market_content
string-array.item: Anybody can publish to the Android Market! \nhttps://market.android.com/
Post-moderated, fast turnaround for upload and upgrade
Paid apps not available in some countries
Some carriers only allow installs from the official Google Android Market

string-array.name: market_alt_content
string-array.item: GetJar \nhttp://www.getjar.com/
Amazon Appstore \nhttp://www.amazon.com/mobile-apps/
SlideME, MobiHand, MiKandi (NSFW!), etc.

string-array.name: market_publish_content
string-array.item: Sign up for an Android Market developer account: \nhttp://market.android.com/publish
Generate a public/private keypair to sign your .apk files
Export a release build and sign it with your private key
Create two screenshots (use emulator or DDMS) and a 512x512 icon
ProGuard (optional): Obfuscates and optimizes!

string-array.name: maintenance_content
string-array.item: Built-in error reporting for ANRs (\"Application Not Responding\") and uncaught exceptions
View and analyze error reports in the same place you manage your apps
Remember to fill in the \"Recent Changes\" area!
Enhanced crash reports by integrating ACRA \nhttp://code.google.com/p/acra/
